member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Sinks.ElasticsearchSink
member.summary: Sink that asynchronously writes entries to a Elasticsearch server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Sinks.ElasticsearchSink.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.TimeSpan,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified connection string and table address.
member.param: The name of the instance originating the entries.
The connection string for the storage account.
Index name prefix formatted as index-{0:yyyy.MM.DD}.
Elasticsearch entry type.
Flatten the payload collection when serializing event entries
The buffering interval to wait for events to accumulate before sending them to Elasticsearch.
The buffering event entry count to wait before sending events to Elasticsearch
The maximum number of entries that can be buffered while it's sending to Windows Azure Storage before the sink starts dropping entries.

Defines a timeout interval for when flushing the entries after an call is received and before disposing the sink. This means that if the timeout period elapses, some event entries will be dropped and not sent to the store. Normally, calling on the will block until all the entries are flushed or the interval elapses. If is specified, then the call will block indefinitely until the flush operation finishes.

member.summary: Provides the sink with new data to write.
member.param: The current entry to write to Windows Azure.

member.summary: Factories and helpers for using the .

member.param: The event stream. Typically this is an instance of .
The name of the instance originating the entries.
The endpoint address for the Elasticsearch Service.
Index name prefix formatted as index-{0:yyyy.MM.DD}
The Elasticsearch entry type
Flatten the payload collection when serializing event entries
The buffering interval between each batch publishing. Default value is .
Defines a timeout interval for when flushing the entries after an call is received and before disposing the sink.
Buffering count to send entries sot Elasticsearch. Default value is

The maximum number of entries that can be buffered while it's sending to Elasticsearch before the sink starts dropping entries. This means that if the timeout period elapses, some event entries will be dropped and not sent to the store. Normally, calling on the will block until all the entries are flushed or the interval elapses. If is specified, then the call will block indefinitely until the flush operation finishes.
member.returns: A subscription to the sink that can be disposed to unsubscribe the sink and dispose it, or to get access to the sink instance.

member.summary: Creates an event listener that logs using a .
member.param: The name of the instance originating the entries.
The endpoint address for the Elasticsearch Service.
Index name prefix formatted as index-{0:yyyy.MM.DD}
The Elasticsearch entry type
Flatten the payload collection when serializing event entries
The buffering interval between each batch publishing.
Defines a timeout interval for the flush operation when the listener is disposed.

The maximum number of entries that can be buffered while it's sending to Elasticsearch before the sink starts dropping entries. This means that if the timeout period elapses, some event entries will be dropped and not sent to the store. Calling on the will block until all the entries are flushed or the interval elapses. If is specified, then the call will block indefinitely until the flush operation finishes.
member.returns: An event listener that uses to log events.
